III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12403 Policy and Procedures
Section (2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
Description following areas:
(j) Visitation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency staff not transporting youth in safety car seats
appropriately for visitations.
Investigation I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 03/28/2023
regarding the allegations. Administrator 1 reported the agency
does provide training for staff related to the proper use of car
seats. Administrator 1 also stated the agency has an adequate
number of car seats and there is also another program within the
agency building that has additional car seats if needed.
Administrator 1 submitted documentation via email on 04/03/2023
related to the training provided by the agency as well as an
inventory of the agency’s car seats.
I interviewed Complainant 1 by telephone on 03/30/2023.
Complainant 1 alleged the agency staff do not use safety seats
properly for children when the children are being transported for
visitation. Complainant 1 also alleged the agency sometimes has
to use the safety seats of care providers because the agency does
not have an adequate number of safety seats available.
Consultant 2 was onsite at the agency on 04/17/2023. Consultant
2 subsequently submitted an email to Consultant 1 confirming the
agency has multiple car/safety seats in a variety of sizes including
infant, toddler/child, and booster seats. Consultant 2 also
confirmed the agency has access to additional seats if needed
from another program that operates within the same building of
this agency.
I interviewed Foster Parent 1 by telephone on 04/19/2023. Foster
Parent 1 reported she has worked regularly with this agency.
Foster Parent 1 stated the agency staff have always used
car/safety seats appropriately when transporting any children in
the care of Foster Parent 1. Foster Parent 1 stated she typically
will observe the children being placed into the seats in case there
2

are any problems. Foster Parent 1 stated this has never been a
problem in Foster Parent 1’s experience with the agency.
Analysis Administrator 1 reported the agency provides training to staff
involved in the transporting of children. Administrator 1 stated the
agency has an adequate inventory of car/safety seats and
available access to additional seats if needed. Administrator 1
provided adequate documentation to support this assessment.
Consultant 2 also substantiated this assessment during
Consultant 2’s onsite visit and observations. The telephone
interview with Foster Parent 1 also confirmed this determination.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
